topics.title: Vehicle Safety
topics.description: Vehicle condition checks, safety systems, and driver actions that reduce risk before and during a journey.

topics.title: Roundabouts
topics.description: Approaching, positioning, signalling, and exiting roundabouts safely, including busy and multi-lane layouts.

topics.title: Legal Requirements
topics.description: Core legal duties for drivers including lane use, compliance, and rules that affect safe and lawful driving.

topics.title: Vulnerable Road Users
topics.description: Protecting pedestrians, children, motorcyclists, and other vulnerable road users through anticipation and caution.

topics.title: Motorways
topics.description: Safe motorway driving, lane discipline, joining and leaving, speed awareness, and managing higher-speed traffic.

topics.title: Weather Conditions
topics.description: Adapting driving technique in rain, fog, ice, wind, and reduced visibility to keep safe control of the vehicle.

topics.title: Cyclist Safety
topics.description: Sharing the road safely with cyclists, giving space, and anticipating cyclist behaviour in urban and rural traffic.

topics.title: Road Signs
topics.description: Recognising common road signs and understanding what actions or restrictions they require while driving.

topics.title: Hazard Awareness
topics.description: Spotting developing hazards early and adjusting speed, position, and planning before situations become unsafe.

topics.title: Traffic Signals
topics.description: Understanding traffic light signals, controlled junctions, and how to respond safely to changing signal phases.

lessons.title: Vehicle Safety: Core Principles
lessons.content:
Build a strong foundation in vehicle safety by focusing on the safest default actions, clear observation, and early planning.

This lesson is paired with the Drivest 1200-question bank. Use the quizzes for active recall, then review explanations to understand why the correct answer is safest and most appropriate for real driving conditions.

When revising vehicle safety, focus on anticipation, legal compliance, and choosing the lowest-risk option rather than the fastest response.
keyPoints: Identify the safest option first in vehicle safety scenarios.
Use observation and anticipation before committing to a manoeuvre or response.
Follow road signs, markings, signals, and legal requirements at all times.
Review explanations after each question to strengthen decision-making patterns.

options.text: Ignore potential risks and maintain speed
Adjust speed and increase awareness
Accelerate to clear the area quickly
Rely on other drivers to react
